alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Scotts Bluff, southwestern Sioux and southeastern Goshen Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 819 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huntley, or 12 miles south of Torrington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. Weak funnel clouds are also possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Morrill, Lyman, Yoder, Huntley, Stegall and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
